item.description:
Since ancient times true religions such as Buddhism and Christianity have preached the importance of self-reflection (or repentance in Christian terms).

In essence, we all have a Buddha nature – a divine nature that shines brilliantly like a diamond. Just as a diamond will collect dirt if it is neglected, so our Divine nature, or soul, inevitably blacken with soot from the regrettable thoughts and deeds we commit as we live in this earthly world.

Self-reflection is a way to clean off the grime and discover the true self – the self that manifests divine nature and is connected to higher dimensions in the Spirit World.

For the last three year, I have been reflecting back on my past in order to better manifest a truer divine spirited self, and each year I am more and more amazed at the power we all have within us to manifest anything that is for our greater self.

Let's get together to reflect on what is keeping your true divine skills polished and what no longer serves you.


Join us in connecting with others who enjoy exploring endless possibilities, seeing all our experiences as a valuable life lesson and creating the change we desire.

We will be meet from 7:00pm-8:30pm.
See you there!
Please call for if you are joining us for the first time.
Ellen
Organizer
617-750-4830

group.name: The North-of-Boston Law of Attraction Meetup Group

item.name: The Power of Reflection
